docs.title: Vindicta Platform
docs.text: The unified competitive Warhammer 40k platform.

docs.title: What is Vindicta?
docs.text:
Vindicta is a comprehensive platform for competitive Warhammer 40k players, tournament organizers, and meta analysts. It provides tools for:

  • Army Management — Build, validate, and share army lists
  • Match Tracking — Log games, track scores, and record key moments
  • Meta Analysis — Discover trending builds and undervalued "sleeper" lists
  • AI Predictions — Get win probability estimates and tactical insights

docs.title: Philosophy
docs.text: Vindicta is built on three core principles:

docs.title: 🎯 Mechanical Fidelity
docs.text: Every rule is implemented exactly as written. No shortcuts, no approximations. When the platform says a unit has a certain ability, it works exactly like it does on the tabletop.

docs.title: 💰 Free Tier First
docs.text: The entire platform runs on GCP Free Tier. No credit card required. No monthly fees. If you're playing competitively, you shouldn't have to pay for basic tools.

docs.title: 🔓 Open Architecture
docs.text: All components are open source and modular. Use the whole platform, or just the pieces you need. Host it yourself, or use our hosted version.

docs.title: Cost Model
docs.text: Free Tier sustainability through the Gas Tank model.

docs.title: The Economic Prime Directive
docs.text: The Vindicta Platform MUST run on GCP Free Tier. No standing monthly costs.

docs.title: Gas Tank Model
docs.text:
Every operation consumes "gas" (credits):

Operation Cost API call 1 credit Dice roll 0.1 credits AI prediction 10 credits Data ingestion 5 credits

New users start with a free allocation. Credits replenish daily.

docs.title: Cost Control
docs.text:
The platform enforces:

  • Hard limits — Operations fail when credits exhausted
  • Soft warnings — Alerts when balance is low
  • No debt — Never accrue negative balance

docs.title: Quota-Aware Scheduling
docs.text:
Background tasks use surplus quota:

Human Request Priority: ALWAYS FIRST
Background Priority: Uses remaining quota
Human Reserve: 50% always reserved

docs.title: Self-Hosting
docs.text:
Self-hosted deployments can configure:

  • Custom credit allocations
  • Unlimited mode (no limits)
  • Custom pricing tiers

docs.title: AI Predictions
docs.text: Win probability and tactical insights powered by Meta-Oracle.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Meta-Oracle uses adversarial AI debate to generate predictions. Five specialized agents argue about outcomes, then a Rule-Sage auditor validates all claims.

docs.title: Win Probability
docs.text:
Get matchup predictions:

vindicta oracle predict \
  --my-list my-list.json \
  --opponent-list opponent.json \
  --mission "Purge the Enemy"

Output:

Win Probability: 62% (±8%)
Key Factors:
  + Your list has superior shooting
  + Mission favors mobile armies
  - Opponent has better objective control

docs.title: Pre-Game Analysis
docs.text:
Before you deploy, get tactical suggestions:

  • Priority targets — What to kill first
  • Deployment tips — Positioning advice
  • Secondary selection — Optimal picks

docs.title: The 5-Agent Swarm
docs.text:
Meta-Oracle's predictions come from debate between:

Agent Role Home Argues for your list Adversary Argues against Arbiter Provides statistical context Rule-Sage Validates mechanical claims Council Synthesizes final prediction

docs.title: Accuracy
docs.text:
Predictions are based on:

  • Historical matchup data
  • Monte Carlo simulations
  • Mechanical rules validation

Disclaimer

Predictions are statistical estimates. Dice rolls, player skill, and unknown factors affect outcomes.

docs.title: Army Management
docs.text: Map units to IDs and record game actions with WARScribe notation.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Vindicta's army management uses the WARScribe notation format — a human-readable, machine-parseable standard for representing Warhammer 40k game actions and unit references.

Scope Clarification

WARScribe is not a list validation tool. It maps unit makeup to IDs and records gameplay actions. List legality validation is out of scope — this is an accepted risk for future projects that may rely on this data.

docs.title: What WARScribe Does
docs.text: In Scope Out of Scope Unit ID mapping Point limit validation Action notation Detachment legality Game event recording Loadout rule enforcement Transcript generation Faction restrictions

docs.title: Unit Registration
docs.text:
Register your units for a match:

vindicta warscribe register \
  --unit "Captain" \
  --id "CPT-01" # May be autogenerated if not provided

Units are tracked by their assigned IDs throughout the game.

docs.title: Action Notation
docs.text:
Record game actions in WARScribe format:

[MOVE: CPT-01 -> Objective-1]
[SHOOT: TNK-02 -> CPT-01]
[CHARGE: TAC-03 -> OBJ-1]
[FIGHT: CPT-01 -> Objective-5]

docs.title: Transcript Generation
docs.text:
After a game, generate a complete transcript:

vindicta warscribe transcript <match-id>

Output:

=== Turn 1 ===
[MOVE: CPT-01 -> Zone-A]
[SHOOT: TNK-02 -> CPT-01, Result: 3 wounds]

=== Turn 2 ===
[CHARGE: TAC-03 -> OBJ-1, Success]
...

docs.title: Known Gaps
docs.text:
Accepted Risk

Lists may declare units that are mechanically illegal according to game rules. Future projects needing list validation will require a separate validation layer. This is documented as an open risk.

docs.title: Match Tracking
docs.text: Record games and analyze your performance.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Track every game from deployment to final score. Vindicta records key moments and generates statistics to improve your play.

docs.title: Creating a Match
docs.text:
Start a new match with:

vindicta match new \
  --player-list my-list.json \
  --opponent-list opponent.json \
  --mission "Purge the Enemy" \
  --deployment "Dawn of War"

Or through the UI:

  1. New Match → Select lists
  2. Choose mission and deployment
  3. Click Start

docs.title: Turn-by-Turn Tracking
docs.text: Log each turn's key events:

docs.title: Scoring
docs.text:
vindicta match score \
  --turn 2 \
  --primary 15 \
  --secondary "Assassinate:4,Engage:3"

docs.title: Key Events
docs.text:
Record critical moments:

  • Unit destroyed
  • Charge declared
  • Stratagem used
  • Battle shock failed

docs.title: Match Summary
docs.text:
View the complete game:

vindicta match summary <match-id>

docs.title: Statistics
docs.text:
Vindicta tracks:

  • Win rate by mission type
  • Average VP per game
  • Unit performance (kills, damage, survival)
  • Faction matchups

docs.title: Match History
docs.text:
Access your full match history:

vindicta match list --last 10

Filter by faction, mission, or date range.

docs.title: Meta Analysis
docs.text: Discover what's winning and find your competitive edge.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Meta Analysis helps you understand the competitive landscape — what armies are winning, which units overperform, and where the "sleeper" lists are hiding.

docs.title: Meta Dashboard
docs.text:
The Meta Dashboard shows:

  • Faction win rates across all levels
  • Top performing lists by event size
  • Trending units (rising and falling)
  • Matchup matrices

docs.title: Sleeper Detection
docs.text:
The Meta-Oracle AI identifies undervalued lists:

"The 5-Agent Debate identifies lists that are statistically underrepresented relative to their win potential."

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
1. Ingestion — Tournament data is collected
  2. Analysis — Win rates are calculated
  3. Debate — AI agents argue for/against lists
  4. Ranking — Sleepers are surfaced
vindicta oracle sleepers --faction "Tyranids"

docs.title: Unit Efficiency
docs.text:
See which units over/underperform:

  • Points efficiency — VP generated per point
  • Survival rate — Games where unit survives
  • Threat range — Effective engagement distance
  • Kill efficiency — Damage dealt per point

docs.title: Data Sources
docs.text:
Vindicta aggregates data from:

  • Major GT results
  • ITC event data
  • Community submitted matches

All data is anonymized and aggregated.

docs.title: Your First Match
docs.text: Learn to record a game from start to finish.

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
You'll need:

  • An army list (in WARScribe format or JSON)
  • Your opponent's list (or a proxy)
  • Vindicta CLI or the Logi-Slate UI

docs.title: Step 1: Validate Your List
docs.text:
Before the game, ensure your list is legal:

CLIUI 
vindicta warscribe validate my-list.json
  1. Open Logi-Slate
  2. Go to Army Lists → Import
  3. Upload or paste your list
  4. Click Validate

docs.title: Step 2: Start a Match
docs.text:
CLIUI 
vindicta match new \
  --player-list my-list.json \
  --opponent-list opponent.json \
  --mission "Purge the Enemy"
  1. Click New Match
  2. Select your list and opponent's list
  3. Choose mission and deployment
  4. Click Start

docs.title: Step 3: Track Each Turn
docs.text:
As the game progresses, log key events:

  • Primary Scoring — Objectives held
  • Secondary Scoring — Points earned
  • Unit Actions — Charges, fights, shooting phases
  • Casualties — Units destroyed

docs.title: Step 4: End the Game
docs.text:
When the game ends:

CLIUI 
vindicta match end --winner player
  1. Click End Match
  2. Verify scores
  3. Click Confirm

docs.title: Step 5: Review
docs.text:
After the match, review your performance:

  • Win rate by mission type
  • Unit efficiency statistics
  • Comparison to meta averages

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get Vindicta running in 5 minutes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.10+
  • uv (recommended) or pip
  • A terminal

docs.title: Option 1: CLI (Recommended)
docs.text:
The fastest way to start is with the unified CLI:

# Install the CLI
uv pip install git+https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Vindicta-CLI.git

# Check installation
vindicta --version

# Roll some dice
vindicta dice roll 2d6

# Validate an army list
vindicta warscribe validate mylist.json

docs.title: Option 2: Local API Server
docs.text:
Run the full platform locally:

# Clone the platform core
git clone https://github.com/vindicta-platform/platform-core.git
cd platform-core

# Install dependencies
uv venv
uv pip install -e ".[dev]"

# Start the server
uvicorn vindicta.api:app --reload

# API is now at http://localhost:8000
# Docs at http://localhost:8000/docs

docs.title: Option 3: UI Only
docs.text:
For the visual experience:

git clone https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Logi-Slate-UI.git
cd Logi-Slate-UI
npm install
npm run dev

# Open http://localhost:3000
